intro.description: This cheat sheet shows how to configure all steps in processing an Sweave document into a final output document of your choice.

item.title: Open Configuration Dialog
item.description:
Go to Run > External Tools > Open External Tools Dialog... and select Sweave (LaTeX+R) Document Processing.
When the Sweave editor is active, you can also access this dialog via Document > Create / Edit Configurations... on the workbench menu bar.
Create a new launch configuration by double-clicking on the selected node or by clicking on the New launch configuration icon. Fill in a Name for this launch configuration.

item.title: 1) Sweave Tab
item.description:
Choose either to skip Sweave in the automated building of the document, to specify an Sweave command to be executed or to invoke an R CMD Sweave on the given file.
Specifying the Sweave command is the most flexible option as it allows the specification of alternative Sweave drivers from add-on packages.
If you want to make use of the R CMD Sweave option, you need to specify the appropriate R CMD launch configuration. To configure a new one, use the Create New button next to the option and follow the explanations in the (optional) next step of this cheat sheet.

item.title: 1.1) R CMD Sweave Config (optional)
item.description:
By clicking on the Create New button in the previous step of this cheat sheet, a new launch configuration for R CMD Tools has been created in the External Tools Dialog.
One may change the Name of this launch configuration if desired. As can be verified, the Sweave Doc Processing option has been preset in the drop-down menu of R CMD tools in the Main tab.
In the R Config tab, one may choose the R configuration that will be used when invoking R CMD Sweave while the Refresh tab allows to automatically refresh resources upon completion of R CMD Sweave.
Click on Apply to save the settings and and go back to the Sweave tab of the Sweave (LaTeX+R) Document configuration in which you would like to make use of this newly created R CMD Sweave configuration.

item.title: 2) LaTeX Tab
item.description: The LaTeX tab allows to specify whether you would like the Sweave'd tex file to be opened in an editor, to what output format and using which command you would like to compile this file.

item.title: 3) Viewer Tab
item.description:
In the Viewer tab one can choose to disable the preview. Alternatively, it is possible to open the compiled documents using Eclipse's default editor / viewer for the chosen output files. A third option is to make use of advanced viewer configurations as provided by View LaTeX Document.
View LaTeX Document launch configurations need to be configured before one can make use of them inside the Viewer tab. To configure a new one, use the Create New button next to the option and follow the explanations in the (optional) next step of this cheat sheet.

item.title: 3.1) View LaTeX Document Config (optional)
item.description:
By clicking on the Create New button in the previous step of this cheat sheet, a new View LaTeX Document launch configuration has been created in the External Tools Dialog.
Change the Name of this launch configuration and choose one of the predefined viewers from the drop-down list in the Viewer tab (e.g. acroread).
Verify whether the path to the viewer executable is correct and change it if needed via the Change... button.
Click on Apply to save the settings and go back to the Viewer tab of the Sweave (LaTeX+R) Document configuration in which you would like to make use of this newly created View LaTeX Document configuration.
